summary: This is an email chain from July 8, 2020, regarding the correction and compliance with a subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in relation to the Epstein investigation. It involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney, an FBI Special Agent, and an unidentified recipient who acknowledges compliance.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York sends a corrected subpoena and corresponds about the investigation.

persons.name: Special Agent II
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent is mentioned as having been previously contacted regarding the subpoena in the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: They are working together on the SDNY investigation, with the prosecutor issuing a subpoena following the FBI agent's outreach.

events.title: Subpoena Correction and Compliance
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a corrected subpoena to an unidentified recipient, who acknowledges timely compliance. The subpoena seeks non-privileged materials related to the Epstein investigation.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued by the SDNY in July 2020 as part of the ongoing Epstein investigation, seeking non-privileged materials.
An error in the original subpoena was corrected and re-sent by an Assistant U.S. Attorney.
The recipient of the subpoena committed to timely compliance.
The communication involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI.
The document highlights continued investigative activity by federal authorities years after Epstein's death.
